solution.item: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes
R2 and R1 connected in series so Rb=R2+R1=2.0000 Ohm
R3 and Rb connected in series so Ra=R3+Rb=3.0000 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3.0000 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R2
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 6.0000 V.
(1) The components R3,Rb connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 6.0000 V.
(1) Rb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rb is Rb/Ra*6.0000 V = 4.0000 V.
(2) The components R2,R1 connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 4.0000 V.
(2) R2 is in the voltage divider so the voltage on R2 is R2/Rb*4.0000 V = 2.0000 V.
To answer the original question: because the VM1 connected to R2 so the voltage on VM1 is 2.0 V
